page.title: 07Interview with Mr.Farmer
page.content: We interviewed Mr Farmer about the years when he used to be a blacksmith. He has lived in the village for 35 years and was born in Barton in 1912. He became a blacksmith after being an errand boy for a grocer. He noticed the blacksmith shop next door and "watched with interest",and a job came up.Other jobs that were available in our village when he came to work here were mainly agricultural.Examples were shepherds,stockman,the miller would employ a man, and farm labourers.Most people that lived in Hibaldstow worked here, because they had no transport. The only transport available was a carrier (horse and caravan) to the market in Brigg.Sometimes a boat would take people from Brandy wharf.
